entry.title: Configuring OWASP ZAP Proxy To Trace Browser Traffic.
entry.summary:
OWASP Zed Attach Proxy (ZAP) is an open source free security tool which is being actively maintained. It helps automatically find security vulnerabilities in your web application by intercepting the traffic between your web browser and application.

In this article, I will be explaining basic steps on how to configure …
entry.content:
OWASP Zed Attach Proxy (ZAP) is an open source free security tool which is being actively maintained. It helps automatically find security vulnerabilities in your web application by intercepting the traffic between your web browser and application.

In this article, I will be explaining basic steps on how to configure ZAP Proxy to trace the browser traffic. I will be covering following:

  • Setting ZAP local proxy
  • Generating & Saving Root CA Certificate
  • Configure CA Certificate in Firefox
  • Configure Proxy in Firefox
  • Testing ZAP Proxy Configuration

Configuring ZAP Proxy To Trace Browser Traffic

Step 1: Setting ZAP Local Proxy

Goto Tool => Options => Local Proxies and set the hostname/ip address and port number for the proxy. In this example, the port is set to 8080 which is selected randomly. Make sure this port is not user by any other application.

Step 2: Generate & Save Root CA Certificate

Goto Tool => Options => Dynamic SSL Certificates and click on Generate button to generate a new Root CA Certificate. Save the newly generated certificate on your hard drive

Step 3: Configure CA Certifcate in Firefox

Goto Settings => Options => Privacy & Security => Certificate => View Certificates => Import and import the newly downloaded Root CA Certificate.

Step 4: Configure Proxy in Firefox

Goto Settings => Preferences => General => Network Proxy => Settings => Manual Proxy Configuration

Step 5: Testing ZAP Proxy Configuration

Once the Proxy & Certificate is set properly, when you navigate to the website, you will start noticing the HTTP Response & Request.

entry.title: Pelican - Static Site Generator - Custom Theme
entry.summary:
This is Part 3 article on Pelican - Static Site Generator. In this article I will be covering following topics:

  • How to customize your Static Site with Pelican Themes

I would highly recommend you to read the following articles before begining with this one

  • Part 1 - Introduction to Pelican - Static Site …
entry.content:
This is Part 3 article on Pelican - Static Site Generator. In this article I will be covering following topics:

  • How to customize your Static Site with Pelican Themes

I would highly recommend you to read the following articles before begining with this one

  • Part 1 - Introduction to Pelican - Static Site Generator
  • Part 2 - Building and Hosting Static Site on GitHub

Pelican Themes

Clone a New Repository from GitHub

Navigate to Pelican Themes GitHub Repository and clone a theme of your choice. You can see the live version of Pelican Themes here

In this example we will be using Flex Theme. GitHub repository can be found here

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ git clone https://github.com/alexandrevicenzi/Flex.git
Cloning into 'Flex'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 4, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (4/4), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
remote: Total 1612 (delta 0), reused 2 (delta 0), pack-reused 1608
Receiving objects: 100% (1612/1612), 5.08 MiB | 2.21 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (914/914), done.

    │       └── messages.po
    ├── messages.pot

    │   └── LC_MESSAGES

    │       ├── messages.mo
    │       └── messages.po

    │   └── LC_MESSAGES
    │       ├── messages.mo
    │       └── messages.po
    ├── tr_TR
    │   └── LC_MESSAGES
    │       ├── messages.mo
    │       └── messages.po
    ├── translation_chart.png
    └── zh_CN
        └── LC_MESSAGES
            ├── messages.mo
            └── messages.po

67 directories, 292 files

Change Default theme of existing Project

Here we will be using existing project and try changing its default theme. If you don't have a project created then refer my previous article for the same.

This is how the site look like with the default Pelican Theme.

Navigate back to your site directory and run pelican to generate your website.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ pelican -s pelicanconf.py content/ -o output/ -t ./../Flex/
Done: Processed 1 article, 0 drafts, 0 pages, 0 hidden pages and 0 draft pages in 0.17 seconds.

See below for details on arguments of pelican command

  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Where to output the generated files. If not specified,
                        a directory will be created, named "output" in the
                        current path. (default: None)
  -s SETTINGS, --settings SETTINGS
                        The settings of the application, this is automatically
                        set to pelicanconf.py if a file exists with this name.
                        (default: None)
  -t THEME, --theme-path THEME
                        Path where to find the theme templates. If not
                        specified, it will use the default one included with
                        pelican. (default: None)

Above command will replace the default Pelican theme with the new theme. You will notice these changes in output/theme folder

Preview site

Navigate back to the parent folder of the site and run 

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ pelican -l content/ -o output/ -s pelicanconf.py -p 8085

See below for details on arguments of pelican command

  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Where to output the generated files. If not specified,
                        a directory will be created, named "output" in the
                        current path. (default: None)
  -s SETTINGS, --settings SETTINGS
                        The settings of the application, this is automatically
                        set to pelicanconf.py if a file exists with this name.
                        (default: None)

  -p PORT, --port PORT  Port to serve HTTP files at. (default: 8000) (default:
                        None)

Open the browser and give localhost:8085 to see your website.

127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET /theme/css/main.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET /theme/css/reset.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET /theme/css/pygment.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET /theme/css/typogrify.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET /theme/css/fonts.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [16/Dec/2018 00:56:33] "GET /theme/fonts/Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.woff HTTP/1.1" 200 -

This is how the Site looks like after the new theme is applied

Yes, It's that easy to change the complete look of your static site.

Enjoy!

entry.title: Pelican - Static Site Generator - Hosted on GitHub
entry.summary:
This is Part 2 article on Pelican - Static Site Generator. In this article I will be covering following topics:

  • Create a Pelican Site from scratch
  • Host the site on GitHub with yourname.github.io

I have covered the following in my Part 1 article on Pelican - Static Site Generator

  • What …
entry.content:
This is Part 2 article on Pelican - Static Site Generator. In this article I will be covering following topics:

  • Create a Pelican Site from scratch
  • Host the site on GitHub with yourname.github.io

I have covered the following in my Part 1 article on Pelican - Static Site Generator

  • What is Pelican?
  • Installation
  • Quick Start
    • Create a blank project
    • Create an Article
    • Generate Site
    • Preview Site

If you are new to Pelican, I would highly recommend you to read that article first before begining with this one. You can find Part 1 of Pelican - Static Site Generator here

Quick Start with GitHub Enabled

Clone a New Repository from GitHub

Create a new repository in github and clone the repository. We will be using that repository folder to create the Static Website.

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ git clone https://github.com/jaiswalsarang/jaiswalsarang.github.io.git
Cloning into 'jaiswalsarang.github.io'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 4, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (4/4), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (4/4), done.
remote: Total 4 (delta 0), reused 0 (delta 0), pack-reused 0
Unpacking objects: 100% (4/4), done.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ ls
LICENSE
SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ tree
.
└── LICENSE

0 directories, 1 file

Create a blank project

Switch to newly created directory. Use pelican-quickstart to create project skeleton. This command will help you create a new Pelican-based website.

It will ask you questions on how you would like to configure your website. Once you have answered these questions it will create the project skeleton accordingly.

To keep it simple, I will be answering No to most of the questions. We will looks at more advanced examples later.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ pelican-quickstart 
Welcome to pelican-quickstart v4.0.1.

This script will help you create a new Pelican-based website.

Please answer the following questions so this script can generate the files
needed by Pelican.


> Where do you want to create your new web site? [.] .
> What will be the title of this web site? SimpleStaticWebSiteHostedOnGitHub
> Who will be the author of this web site? Sarang Jaiswal
> What will be the default language of this web site? [en] 
> Do you want to specify a URL prefix? e.g., https://example.com   (Y/n) 
> What is your URL prefix? (see above example; no trailing slash) http://jaiswalsarang.github.io
> Do you want to enable article pagination? (Y/n) 
> How many articles per page do you want? [10] 
> What is your time zone? [Europe/Paris] US/Central
> Do you want to generate a tasks.py/Makefile to automate generation and publishing? (Y/n) Y
> Do you want to upload your website using FTP? (y/N) 
> Do you want to upload your website using SSH? (y/N) 
> Do you want to upload your website using Dropbox? (y/N) 
> Do you want to upload your website using S3? (y/N) 
> Do you want to upload your website using Rackspace Cloud Files? (y/N) 
> Do you want to upload your website using GitHub Pages? (y/N) Y
> Is this your personal page (username.github.io)? (y/N) Y
Done. Your new project is available at /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io

Following files were created in your project folder.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ ls -ltr
total 40
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  1070 Dec 11 20:49 LICENSE
drwxr-xr-x  2 sarangjaiswal  staff    64 Dec 11 20:52 content
drwxr-xr-x  2 sarangjaiswal  staff    64 Dec 11 20:52 output
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff   883 Dec 11 20:52 pelicanconf.py
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff   619 Dec 11 20:52 publishconf.py
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2107 Dec 11 20:52 tasks.py
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2923 Dec 11 20:52 Makefile

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ tree
.
├── LICENSE
├── Makefile
├── content
├── output
├── pelicanconf.py
├── publishconf.py
└── tasks.py

2 directories, 5 files

All the article or blog post written in either markdown or restructured text goes in content folder. The actual html for static website will be generated in output folder.

Create an article

Navigate to content folder and open your favorite text editor (in my case vim) and add the following content and save the file.

SarangMac:output sarangjaiswal$ vi Pelican-is-awesome.md

title: Pelican Is Awesome
category: Python
tags: Python, Pelican, Static Website
date: 2018-12-07
modified: 2018-12-07

# Pelican is Awesome!
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, et lobortis ullamcorper vix, an ridens accusam argumentum eam. Porro mollis invenire ne nam, tractatos petentium reprimique cu quo. Aperiam facilis sea et, sadipscing ullamcorper an duo. No duis ferri autem qui, est quot discere corrumpit cu, mel ea veri eligendi iudicabit. Sit ne homero dolorum.
Nec ut porro admodum contentiones, ex propriae scriptorem vituperatoribus mea, sit et duis deterruisset. Eu velit elitr quo, ne pertinax quaerendum eam, in nam unum admodum. Novum fabulas nonumes quo ne. Duo id vero porro dicant, te mel solet efficiantur.
Nonumes fastidii propriae eu qui. Eam doctus dolorum ea. Te per audire verterem, cu eam commodo accusamus expetendis, mea cu nibh adipiscing. Te est aperiam volumus definitionem, an sea nostro indoctum repudiare.
No vel amet meliore pericula, summo malorum ex eos. Ad ius unum labore voluptua, ne eius reque conclusionemque ius. Ei his sale veniam inimicus. Insolens pertinacia ne has, ei mel deleniti erroribus reformidans, ne debet eirmod vocibus est.
Per causae omittam omittantur in, pri cu cetero facilis honestatis. Vix dicat equidem ex, ne duo suas offendit referrentur. Admodum percipit accusamus cu mel, ei sit nemore labitur lucilius, ius no eruditi indoctum. Choro iriure cotidieque cum no, ius ei exerci rationibus. Vim minimum sensibus eu. Sed omnium gubergren assentior ei, melius intellegam id usu, etiam albucius te his.

SarangMac:output sarangjaiswal$ ls -ltr
total 8
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  1562 Dec  9 21:53 Pelican-is-awesome.md

Generate site

Navigate back to your site directory and run pelican to generate your website.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ pelican -s pelicanconf.py content/ -o output/
Done: Processed 1 article, 0 drafts, 0 pages, 0 hidden pages and 0 draft pages in 0.15 seconds.

See below for details on arguments of pelican command

  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Where to output the generated files. If not specified,
                        a directory will be created, named "output" in the
                        current path. (default: None)
  -s SETTINGS, --settings SETTINGS
                        The settings of the application, this is automatically
                        set to pelicanconf.py if a file exists with this name.
                        (default: None)

Above command will convert your Markdown (.md) file into html. All the converted files will be placed in output directory.

SarangMac:SiteWithGitHub sarangjaiswal$ ls -ltr output/
total 64
drwxr-xr-x  5 sarangjaiswal  staff   160 Dec  9 21:54 theme
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  4472 Dec  9 21:55 pelican-is-awesome.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  4378 Dec  9 21:55 index.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2305 Dec  9 21:55 tags.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2136 Dec  9 21:55 categories.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2193 Dec  9 21:55 authors.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2199 Dec  9 21:55 archives.html
drwxr-xr-x  5 sarangjaiswal  staff   160 Dec  9 21:55 tag
drwxr-xr-x  3 sarangjaiswal  staff    96 Dec  9 21:55 category
drwxr-xr-x  3 sarangjaiswal  staff    96 Dec  9 21:55 author
SarangMac:SiteWithGitHub sarangjaiswal$ tree output/
output/
├── archives.html
├── author
│   └── sarang-jaiswal.html
├── authors.html
├── categories.html
├── category
│   └── python.html
├── index.html
├── pelican-is-awesome.html
├── tag
│   ├── pelican.html
│   ├── python.html
│   └── static-website.html
├── tags.html
└── theme
    ├── css
    │   ├── fonts.css
    │   ├── main.css
    │   ├── pygment.css
    │   ├── reset.css
    │   ├── typogrify.css
    │   └── wide.css
    ├── fonts
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.eot
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.svg
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.ttf
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.woff
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.woff2
    │   └── font.css
    └── images
        └── icons
            ├── aboutme.png
            ├── bitbucket.png
            ├── delicious.png
            ├── facebook.png
            ├── github.png
            ├── gitorious.png
            ├── gittip.png
            ├── google-groups.png
            ├── google-plus.png
            ├── hackernews.png
            ├── lastfm.png
            ├── linkedin.png
            ├── reddit.png
            ├── rss.png
            ├── slideshare.png
            ├── speakerdeck.png
            ├── stackoverflow.png
            ├── twitter.png
            ├── vimeo.png
            └── youtube.png

8 directories, 43 files

Preview site

Navigate back to the parent folder of the site and run 

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ pelican -l content/ -o output/ -s pelicanconf.py -p 8085

See below for details on arguments of pelican command

  -t THEME, --theme-path THEME
                        Path where to find the theme templates. If not
                        specified, it will use the default one included with
                        pelican. (default: None)
  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Where to output the generated files. If not specified,
                        a directory will be created, named "output" in the
                        current path. (default: None)
  -s SETTINGS, --settings SETTINGS
                        The settings of the application, this is automatically
                        set to pelicanconf.py if a file exists with this name.
                        (default: None)

  -p PORT, --port PORT  Port to serve HTTP files at. (default: 8000) (default:
                        None)

Open the browser and give localhost:8085 to see your website.

127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET /theme/css/main.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET /theme/css/reset.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET /theme/css/pygment.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET /theme/css/typogrify.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET /theme/css/fonts.css HTTP/1.1" 200 -
127.0.0.1 - - [11/Dec/2018 21:01:12] "GET /theme/fonts/Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.woff HTTP/1.1" 200 -

Use Make file to build and push it to Github

Navigate back to the parent folder of the site and run make command. This will show you all the options which can be used.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ make
Makefile for a pelican Web site                                           

Usage:                                                                    
   make html                           (re)generate the web site          
   make clean                          remove the generated files         
   make regenerate                     regenerate files upon modification 
   make publish                        generate using production settings 
   make serve [PORT=8000]              serve site at http://localhost:8000
   make serve-global [SERVER=0.0.0.0]  serve (as root) to :80    
   make devserver [PORT=8000]          serve and regenerate together      
   make ssh_upload                     upload the web site via SSH        
   make rsync_upload                   upload the web site via rsync+ssh  
   make github                         upload the web site via gh-pages   

Set the DEBUG variable to 1 to enable debugging, e.g. make DEBUG=1 html   
Set the RELATIVE variable to 1 to enable relative urls

Use make html to regenerate the static website. This is similar to pelican -s pelicanconf.py content/ -o output/ command which we used earlier.

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ make html
pelican /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/content -o /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/output -s /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/pelicanconf.py 
Done: Processed 1 article, 0 drafts, 0 pages, 0 hidden pages and 0 draft pages in 0.11 seconds.

Use make github to push the files from output folder to github

SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ make github
pelican /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/content -o /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/output -s /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/publishconf.py 
Done: Processed 1 article, 0 drafts, 0 pages, 0 hidden pages and 0 draft pages in 0.13 seconds.
ghp-import -m "Generate Pelican site" -b master /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/output
git push origin master
Username for 'https://github.com': jaiswalsarang
Password for 'https://jaiswalsarang@github.com': 
Counting objects: 56, done.
Delta compression using up to 12 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (53/53), done.
Writing objects: 100% (56/56), 132.07 KiB | 11.01 MiB/s, done.
Total 56 (delta 13), reused 0 (delta 0)
remote: Resolving deltas: 100% (13/13), done.
To https://github.com/jaiswalsarang/jaiswalsarang.github.io.git
   92a5245..78342fd  master -> master

Navigate to yourname.github.io to see the site live on web. It should look something like below

Issues

Below were few issues which I came across while creating this article. I have listed the issue and the solution for each of them below

If the live website looks something like below then there is some issue with the theme css file.

Make following changes to the Makefile

Original:

publish:
    $(PELICAN) $(INPUTDIR) -o $(OUTPUTDIR) -s $(PUBLISHCONF) $(PELICANOPTS)

Change to:

publish:
    $(PELICAN) $(INPUTDIR) -o $(OUTPUTDIR) -s $(CONFFILE) $(PELICANOPTS)
If you came across the below The requested URL returned error: 403 error then refer the Stack Overflow here to resolve it.
SarangMac:jaiswalsarang.github.io sarangjaiswal$ make github
pelican /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/content -o /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/output -s /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/publishconf.py 
Done: Processed 1 article, 0 drafts, 0 pages, 0 hidden pages and 0 draft pages in 0.12 seconds.
ghp-import -m "Generate Pelican site" -b master /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples/jaiswalsarang.github.io/output
git push origin master
remote: Permission to jaiswalsarang/jaiswalsarang.github.io.git denied to sarangjaiswal.
fatal: unable to access 'https://github.com/jaiswalsarang/jaiswalsarang.github.io.git/': The requested URL returned error: 403
make: *** [github] Error 128

entry.title: Pelican - Static Site Generator - Basics
entry.summary:
This is a quick tutorial on how to create a Static Website using Pelican.

What is a Pelican?

Pelican is a open source static website generator that supports Markdown or restructured Text. Its based on Python. More details on Pelican can be found here

I'll introduce you to the basics …
entry.content:
This is a quick tutorial on how to create a Static Website using Pelican.

What is a Pelican?

Pelican is a open source static website generator that supports Markdown or restructured Text. Its based on Python. More details on Pelican can be found here

I'll introduce you to the basics of Pelicann. If you already know Pelican, and want to jump straight to learning about the fancier things, I suggest you skip this blog post and look for other articles on Pelican on my Blog.

Also, I will be demonstating on MacOS, but the steps are more or less same for other popular platforms like Windows and Linux.

Let's jump right in.

Installation

Before we get started, lets install Pelican.

SarangMac:~ sarangjaiswal$ pip install pelican
Collecting pelican
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/a4/80/0a474a4aa30fab1666f63c2118d89bcbc05dc3180d791ab90d5e90b7f2e0/pelican-4.0.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Requirement already satisfied: unidecode in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (1.0.23)
Requirement already satisfied: blinker in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (1.4)
Requirement already satisfied: docutils in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (0.14)
Requirement already satisfied: pytz>=0a in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (2018.7)
Requirement already satisfied: python-dateutil in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (2.7.5)
Requirement already satisfied: six>=1.4 in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (1.11.0)
Requirement already satisfied: feedgenerator>=1.9 in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (1.9)
Requirement already satisfied: pygments in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (2.3.0)
Requirement already satisfied: jinja2>=2.7 in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from pelican) (2.10)
Requirement already satisfied: MarkupSafe>=0.23 in /Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/3.6/lib/python3.6/site-packages (from jinja2>=2.7->pelican) (1.1.0)
Installing collected packages: pelican
Successfully installed pelican-4.0.1

I would reommend you to install Markdown as well. You will be using this to generate Articles on your website/blog.

SarangMac:~ sarangjaiswal$ pip install markdown
Collecting markdown
  Using cached https://files.pythonhosted.org/packages/7a/6b/5600647404ba15545ec37d2f7f58844d690baf2f81f3a60b862e48f29287/Markdown-3.0.1-py2.py3-none-any.whl
Installing collected packages: markdown
Successfully installed markdown-3.0.1

Quick Start

Create a blank project

Create a folder where and name it appropriately for your site and switch to that directory. User pelican-quickstart to create project skeleton. This command will help you create a new Pelican-based website.

It will ask you questions on how you would like to configure your website. Once you have answered these questions it will create the project skeleton accordingly.

To keep it simple, I will be answering No to most of the questions. We will looks at more advanced examples later.

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ pelican-quickstart 
Welcome to pelican-quickstart v4.0.1.

This script will help you create a new Pelican-based website.

Please answer the following questions so this script can generate the files
needed by Pelican.


> Where do you want to create your new web site? [.] .
> What will be the title of this web site? SimplePelicanWebSite
> Who will be the author of this web site? Sarang Jaiswal
> What will be the default language of this web site? [en] 
> Do you want to specify a URL prefix? e.g., https://example.com   (Y/n) n
> Do you want to enable article pagination? (Y/n) n
> What is your time zone? [Europe/Paris] US/Central
> Do you want to generate a tasks.py/Makefile to automate generation and publishing? (Y/n) n
Done. Your new project is available at /Users/sarangjaiswal/Documents/Workspace/Examples

Following files were created in your project folder.

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ ls -ltr
total 16
drwxr-xr-x  2 sarangjaiswal  staff   64 Dec  8 12:54 content
drwxr-xr-x  2 sarangjaiswal  staff   64 Dec  8 12:54 output
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  873 Dec  8 12:54 pelicanconf.py
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  589 Dec  8 12:54 publishconf.py

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ tree
.
├── content
├── output
├── pelicanconf.py
└── publishconf.py

2 directories, 2 files

All the article or blog post written in either markdown or restructured text goes in content folder. The actual html for static website will be generated in output folder.

Create an article

Navigate to content folder and open your favorite text editor (in my case vim) and add the following content and save the file.

SarangMac:output sarangjaiswal$ vi Pelican-is-awesome.md

title: Pelican Is Awesome
category: Python
tags: Python, Pelican, Static Website
date: 2018-12-07
modified: 2018-12-07

# Pelican is Awesome!
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, et lobortis ullamcorper vix, an ridens accusam argumentum eam. Porro mollis invenire ne nam, tractatos petentium reprimique cu quo. Aperiam facilis sea et, sadipscing ullamcorper an duo. No duis ferri autem qui, est quot discere corrumpit cu, mel ea veri eligendi iudicabit. Sit ne homero dolorum.
Nec ut porro admodum contentiones, ex propriae scriptorem vituperatoribus mea, sit et duis deterruisset. Eu velit elitr quo, ne pertinax quaerendum eam, in nam unum admodum. Novum fabulas nonumes quo ne. Duo id vero porro dicant, te mel solet efficiantur.
Nonumes fastidii propriae eu qui. Eam doctus dolorum ea. Te per audire verterem, cu eam commodo accusamus expetendis, mea cu nibh adipiscing. Te est aperiam volumus definitionem, an sea nostro indoctum repudiare.
No vel amet meliore pericula, summo malorum ex eos. Ad ius unum labore voluptua, ne eius reque conclusionemque ius. Ei his sale veniam inimicus. Insolens pertinacia ne has, ei mel deleniti erroribus reformidans, ne debet eirmod vocibus est.
Per causae omittam omittantur in, pri cu cetero facilis honestatis. Vix dicat equidem ex, ne duo suas offendit referrentur. Admodum percipit accusamus cu mel, ei sit nemore labitur lucilius, ius no eruditi indoctum. Choro iriure cotidieque cum no, ius ei exerci rationibus. Vim minimum sensibus eu. Sed omnium gubergren assentior ei, melius intellegam id usu, etiam albucius te his.

SarangMac:output sarangjaiswal$ ls -ltr
total 8
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  1566 Dec  8 13:23 Pelican-is-awesome.md

Generate site

Navigate back to your site directory and run pelican to generate your website.

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ pelican -s pelicanconf.py content/ -o output/
Done: Processed 1 article, 0 drafts, 0 pages, 0 hidden pages and 0 draft pages in 0.12 seconds.

See below for details on arguments of pelican command

  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Where to output the generated files. If not specified,
                        a directory will be created, named "output" in the
                        current path. (default: None)
  -s SETTINGS, --settings SETTINGS
                        The settings of the application, this is automatically
                        set to pelicanconf.py if a file exists with this name.
                        (default: None)

Above command will convert your Markdown (.md) file into html. All the converted files will be placed in output directory.

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ ls -ltr output/
total 64
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  4486 Dec  8 17:23 pelican-is-awesome.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  4378 Dec  8 17:23 index.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2263 Dec  8 17:23 tags.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2094 Dec  8 17:23 categories.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2151 Dec  8 17:23 authors.html
-rw-r--r--  1 sarangjaiswal  staff  2157 Dec  8 17:23 archives.html
drwxr-xr-x  5 sarangjaiswal  staff   160 Dec  8 17:23 tag
drwxr-xr-x  3 sarangjaiswal  staff    96 Dec  8 17:23 category
drwxr-xr-x  3 sarangjaiswal  staff    96 Dec  8 17:23 author
drwxr-xr-x  5 sarangjaiswal  staff   160 Dec  8 17:23 theme
SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ tree output/
output/
├── archives.html
├── author
│   └── sarang-jaiswal.html
├── authors.html
├── categories.html
├── category
│   └── python.html
├── index.html
├── pelican-is-awesome.html
├── tag
│   ├── pelican.html
│   ├── python.html
│   └── static-website.html
├── tags.html
└── theme
    ├── css
    │   ├── fonts.css
    │   ├── main.css
    │   ├── pygment.css
    │   ├── reset.css
    │   ├── typogrify.css
    │   └── wide.css
    ├── fonts
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.eot
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.svg
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.ttf
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.woff
    │   ├── Yanone_Kaffeesatz_400.woff2
    │   └── font.css
    └── images
        └── icons
            ├── aboutme.png
            ├── bitbucket.png
            ├── delicious.png
            ├── facebook.png
            ├── github.png
            ├── gitorious.png
            ├── gittip.png
            ├── google-groups.png
            ├── google-plus.png
            ├── hackernews.png
            ├── lastfm.png
            ├── linkedin.png
            ├── reddit.png
            ├── rss.png
            ├── slideshare.png
            ├── speakerdeck.png
            ├── stackoverflow.png
            ├── twitter.png
            ├── vimeo.png
            └── youtube.png

8 directories, 43 files

Preview site

Navigate back to the parent folder of the site and run 

SarangMac:Examples sarangjaiswal$ pelican -l content/ -o output/ -s pelicanconf.py -p 8082

See below for details on arguments of pelican command

  -t THEME, --theme-path THEME
                        Path where to find the theme templates. If not
                        specified, it will use the default one included with
                        pelican. (default: None)
  -o OUTPUT, --output OUTPUT
                        Where to output the generated files. If not specified,
                        a directory will be created, named "output" in the
                        current path. (default: None)
  -s SETTINGS, --settings SETTINGS
                        The settings of the application, this is automatically
                        set to pelicanconf.py if a file exists with this name.
                        (default: None)

  -p PORT, --port PORT  Port to serve HTTP files at. (default: 8000) (default:
                        None)

Open the browser and give localhost:8082 to see your website.

127.0.0.1 - - [08/Dec/2018 17:54:47] "GET / HTTP/1.1" 200 -
